thread.title: DC Download: YouTube Vs. Netflix, Framebridge Galleries & 1776 Crystal City
thread.title_full: DC Download: YouTube Vs. Netflix, Framebridge Galleries & 1776 Crystal City

author: Eric Hal Schwartz
title: DC Download: YouTube Vs. Netflix, Framebridge Galleries & 1776 Crystal City
text: Image via DC Inno It's Official: 1776 Prepares Grand Opening in Crystal City DC-based startup incubator and seed fund 1776 will unveil its Crystal City in full capacity next week on Wednesday. Expect flair, finesse and some of the area's top tech figures. In April, 1776 acquired neighboring incubator Disruption Corp, which has been redesigned and organized under the 1776 brand. Stay tuned. -- Chris Bing Related Paul Singh's Email Shows Disruption Corp. Was Nearly Out of Cash V.A. Cloud Co. Scores $175M Acquisition McLean-based GTT Communications, a cloud networking services developer, announced the completion of the $175 million acquisition of Texas-based One Source Networks (OSN) on Thursday. OSN is also a communications and managed cloud networking co. -- Chris Bing Can YouTube be the next Netflix? YouTube wants to cash in on some of the same success as Netflix and Amazon Fire with a new venture called YouTube Red. Paying 10 bucks a month will get you a combination of features including no ads, the ability to save videos offline and use the newly launched YouTube Gaming app and upcoming YouTube Music app. Most importantly, you'll get access to original movies and television shows that YouTube is producing. But is a show called Fight of the Dead really going to draw eyes? Google's Alphabetic earnings Alphabet, as Google is now officially called, released its earnings report on Thursday. Find out why Larry Page and Sergey Brin should make letter jackets in Chris Bing's report here . Framebridge makes your wall an art gallery Maryland-based custom framing tech startup FrameBridge is expanding its services into helping people design and build gallery walls. The startup, which has raised close to $11.5 million in two years, much of it from Revolution, is adding the new concierge service on top of its current custom framing service. Think of it like an Instagram collage on your wall, only with probably less pictures of your lunch. Last day for 50 on Fire nominations! If you've been procrastinating nominating yourself, your company or just someone you think should win, today's your last chance to get that nomination in . Then come to our next Meet the Judges happy hour Nov. 5. All the tech news in D.C. you need to know.
